reviews.review_msg: His lectures were dense and hard to follow, forcing you to learn the material on your own.  His exams were also not a great test of the material, as the averages were often failing grades. I would recommend you take this course with another professor.

The professor is really nice and freakishly smart. I asked him about a few coding interview problems i got stuck on and he can just instantly find the solution

For this course, the midterms are only questions from the textbook. The people who got 100% all went through each problem with chatgpt/google and ignored the slides. The final though...
prof is okay but horrible TA.

MY GOAT. This prof is awesome. Although he may not be the best at lectures, he clears any professor in terms of tests. He gives clear instruction for the midterms and finals. Questions don't deviate much from what you've already done in the homework. As long as you know how to solve homework questions and don't rely on ChatGPT, you should be fine.
Extremely fair midterms and finals, if you do the textbook questions and assignments they are a breeze
Terrible professor. Could not understand anything he said. Makes the concepts more harder than needed.

Very fair exams. Reasonable expectations. Hard to read questions if you're not used to mathematical notation.
Recommendation is that you don't solely rely on his slides, also look at other resources and do a few LC easy/med questions.

A great professor. The people complaining about his accent are wild, he has an accent but he speaks clearly and is easy to understand. Assignments and exams were difficult but fair. If you do the assignments and make sure you understand them you will do well. His lectures are good and he will answer all questions thoughtfully.
So hard

Ignore what others say about his accent. He's PERFECTLY understandable, these people just want an excuse for their lack of effort. This is one of the better profs of the faculty, he's very fair and responds quickly to questions. The assignments are fantastic for preparing for the midterm. Grading distribution is great too. Very respectable prof.

The problem, first of all, is that you would not understand any word he says. This is an Algorithm class, and you'd find the class challenging even with a professor who can speak clear English. Do not believe students when they say he's the GOAT. He's not! Anything you learn will be from your own self-study. It's useless attending his class.
Very lenient marking. If you don't mind learning everything on your own, you can take this to get a good mark. Lectures are just him reading the textbook.

Gu was very lenient on grading which was helpful for such a tough class. The assignments were basically free marks. The midterms and final were graded by few questions which could be tough if you didn't understand a question.

I would take 307 with him again. Sometimes he is hard to understand but he is a nice enough guy and not a bad choice.
Very bad teaching skills. Kind of hard to understand what he is saying. Teaching an important course at too early in the morning.

The most useless course I've ever taken in my academic life. I could barely understand anything he said in class. His lecture materials are harder to understand than the textbook. I had to download materials from other schools to understand concepts. What is most annoying about the course is that asides from the horrible grade, I learned NOTHING.

The course is extremely heavy and he didn't try to make it better. Writing this review 16 hours before the final exam and half of the assignments are not graded yet. 12 chapters are included in the final exam that's worth 40% of the total grade. His explanation is OK at best. Excruciatingly hard assignments that are worth only 5% each.

I didn't like CMPT 307 with him at first. But as time went by, I came to enjoy it. He answered everyone's questions immediately (literally!) during lectures, and his assignments & exams were fair. The only con is that his lectures are not that good. But I think his handling of other things really makes up for it. He is also very nice and reasonable

This professor maybe not the best professor i have met in university life, but he is one of those most caring one. He always replies email very quick, not like other professors and TAs. If you have any questions, you are welcome to ask him. He is very supportive and willing to help. I never thought of passing this course with a B-.
Pretty old school (boring) lectures. Exams and assignments were graded lieniently, but that also meant there wasn't much feedback.

I agree with the good feedback below. He makes complex concepts in algorithm matters easier. I liked his way of caring for students. His exams are fair and only asked the important part of the course, not covering all the trivial details.

Professor Gu is knowledgeable in computer algorithm. His accent gave me NO TROUBLE in understanding the course, some comments here are unfair! Gu cares about his students and gave extension on the assignments/exams to students who had health issues. Everytime I asked him questions, he could answer my questions clearly and encouraged me to think.

I really like this man. He clearly knows his material. He is caring but not pretentious at all. He doesn't seem eager for praise or recognition but just does his job well. He is often amused by students' questions but answers them clearly. Students mock him because of accent and grammar but to be honest his English is really good.

The prof defines the (admittedly complex) material clearly and adequately. He is adept at understanding answering students' questions during lecture. Test difficulty is on par with assignments and feels fair. Low amount of work required (roughly 4 hour long assignments, due every 2-3 weeks). His accent may be hard to understand for some.

No effort put into classes. Lectures just zoom by advanced topics with minimal detail. His slides are only excerpts copy & pasted from the textbook. I wish he'd at least give us time to understand the material. His accent is super confusing as well. Surprised they let these kinds of professors teach!

He looks cold and dull, but is indeed approachable and warm-hearted inside. Always reply to emails quickly and try his best to help you for any questions or requests. Language barrier may sometimes be a problem, but it is totally understandable as he actually speaks three languages(Japanese also). Don't be hard on this.
The worst prof I've ever had at SFU. His accent is hard to understand even for Chinese speakers. He doesn't know how to teach at all, all he does is reading slides.

He is the worst lecturer ever in SFU. I will suggest no one to take course with him. The quality is zero, you wont understand a word in class due to language barrier and the exam is extremely irrelevant and super hard to be done in time. He is also very tough on grade.

Accent isn't that bad once you get used to it. Slides are cryptic and he doesn't answer questions in lecture clearly. Weird terminology sometimes. He was really understanding when I had a medical issue though so thumbs up for that.

wonderful prof. explains things clearly, everything posted online so attendance is optional. exams are fair and its easy to do well if you put in some studying. The accent is not a problem. AT all. I dont know how people complaining about that survive in this city. Highly recommend.

The instructor has a slight accent, but hey we live in multi culture society, all matters is how good he is. Indeed, he is extremely good at explaining the concept, and those details you will remember forever. Midterm and finals are quite reasonable. Highly recommend him and do NOT skip his lecture. Reading book is optional, all mats is in lectures

Easy course. Prof is nice. True, he has an accent problem but since everything can be learnt from notes,  it doesn't really matter. Exam are based on assignments, midterm is a bit hard due to limited time, final is extremely easy.

exams were unexpected, too much reading. cmpt371 other prof covered up to ch 6 of the same book. we did up to ch 9 + another text book. exams not closely related to homework assignment questions. take with another prof.

Would avoid. Covers two textbooks which is over 1100 pages of material, gets flustered when people ask him what to study because there is so much material. Didn't learn anything, midterm very difficult.
He is useless. And never share notes with students. Midterm is really really hard.

Poor instructor abilities. Sounds like a recording (just tries to get the lecture out of the way so he can go back to research). Doesn't prepare you for his midtermsfinals - they hit you like a train when you have them. Assignment submission system he has is annoying (drop it on a folder an NFS, what happened to coursys?)
Didnt really learn much from 471.  Assignments were easy and on the same level as 371. Lectures are almost not worth going to as slides cover everything.
He is dull and sometimes hard to understand but all assignments and exams are based off notes and homework. As long as you keep up with those you will get a great mark in his course.
Notes are crystal clear. Exams are straightforward. Extremely helpful and approachable.

The worst thing about Gu is that he teaches two books, but doesn't clarify to study which chapters! you will be surprised by questions from never thought chapters in extremely difficult final exam.AVOID

Gu is reasonable, although his English makes it hard to understand him completely. Also, three-hour long lectures may put you to sleep. Nevertheless, he has very good notes and you may read the book/ use google groups. The assignments come from the book, which is somewhat confusing. If in doubt about the assignment questions go to Gu directly.

Sounds like Kermit the frog, but with HORRIBLE grammar + accent. His teaching was boring, and not helpful for the assigns. Lecture notes were very unclear, and did not even have the diagrams he used from the book. $160(new) so look for pdf or used copy. Final exam WTF it was outta the blue. Read the book and know the graphs well. Turn off your CELL

I was very excited about computer networking before I took this course with Mr.Gu. Well not anymore! While the book discusses some of the latest technologies, class discussions are monotonous, fast-paced and hard to follow. Even though some of the classes' finest minds were helping me understand the assignments, I found them to be quite hard.AVOID!
does not make class very interesting at all.  weak prof at best..
No Comments

WORST prof. I have ever had at SFU. Had to complete and hand in homework before he even goes over the chapters for the assignment. Can't understand a single word coming out of his mouth, won't clarify questions on the exams (despite his atrocious grammar, which makes it hard to discern exactly *what* he wants us to answer.)  Avoid him at all costs.

Lecture notes are overly simplified that you could have ahard time understanding them. His English is sub-par at most, making him difficult to understand. Assignments are straight from book, but his solutions are not helpful and asking him would not help you. His midterms and (especially) final exam will have you go, "WTF?!".

Never take 371 with Gu. His lectures were horrible and his attitude sucks! For his lectures he memorized and read word for word from the textbook, no preperation. The assignment questions were also from the book and he managed to mark them unfairly without giving much explanation. Did not synthesize material. Gave no context. Two thumbs down!

Little difficult to understand his English sometimes; Assignments are straight from the book; His lecture notes are overly simplified and does not help most of the time, so lecture attendence is a must; You really got to read the book to understand what he is talking about in the lectures; His midterm and final are okay.
very good prof...
very nice prof. well organized and work load is fine

Nice, good organization, high interest to the coures make him such a high-rating prof. Willing to listen and very helpful on assignment. The class's overall average was 82%! Although he offers this course once per year, believe me, take his 471.
